content.description: Start with a foot on the bottom on the small ledge that juts out above the pine needles. Figure the rest out. Stay on the rock side of the tree up the hump.
content.protection: Spotter. Starts already on a slope, would be hard to get good placement of a pad.
content.location: In the general vicinity of the large rock face on the right side of the path when walking towards the primary boulder.

content.description: Start on the right-side bottom and kick left foot out to a step created at the bottom of a flake. Get body up and work left and up the hump on the left side of the photo. Not many good holds (or I couldn't find any) and tricky foot movements/reaches.
content.protection: Pad and spotter if possible. Landing isn't too bad but there is certainly potential for injury.
content.location: Trail behind Portsmouth High School baseball field. When it forks, go left, the right side of the fork starts with a small wooden bridge. Walk along the path with the large rock face on your right and other scattered rocks until you see this just off of the trail in front of you.

content.description: Behind Portsmouth High School is a large patch of woods with trails that are used for the Cross Country team’s practices, but are also accessible to the public. Easily accessible and not difficult to find. The boulder is not huge but it has a nice overhang with potential for several routes. The slabs are less interesting but maybe worth checking out. Fairly secluded and shady in the wooded area.
